자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: In the end, it rained so we couldn't go.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Sino-Korean: 結 (conclude) + 局 (situation). Implies outcome after a process or series of events.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: At last, the exam is over!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: More dramatic/literary than 드디어. Emphasizes a long-awaited result with emotional weight.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 서울은 비가 왔어요. 한편, 부산은 맑았어요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It rained in Seoul. Meanwhile, it was sunny in Busan.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Sino-Korean: 一 (one) + 片 (side). Introduces contrasting or parallel information.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).english: moreover / besides / on top of that
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's raining, and on top of that, it's windy.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean conjunction. Adds additional information that reinforces the previous point.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 비가 많이 와요. 따라서 우산을 가져가세요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's raining a lot. Therefore, take an umbrella.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: More formal than 그래서. Common in writing, presentations, and formal speech.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).english: that is / namely / in other words
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Tomorrow, that is, Monday, we start.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Used to rephrase or clarify. Written form of i.e. Sino-Korean: 卽 (immediately/namely).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 과일을 좋아해요. 예를 들면, 사과나 딸기요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I like fruit. For example, apples or strawberries.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Sino-Korean: 例 (example) + 들다 (give). Shortened to 예를 들어 in speech.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 형은 키가 커요. 반면에 저는 작아요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: My older brother is tall. On the other hand, I'm short.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Sino-Korean: 反 (opposite) + 面 (side). Used to contrast two different situations.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I was worried, but it was actually fun instead.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Indicates opposite of what was expected; a surprising contrast.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Anyway, we have to do it.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean with casual tone. Used to dismiss previous discussion and move on.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Of course I'll help!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Sino-Korean: 勿 (not) + 論 (argument) = 'no argument about it'. Frequently used in polite speech.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Actually, I don't really know either.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: As noun means 'fact'; as adverb 'actually'. Phrase: 사실은 (the truth is) opens honest revelation.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: In any case, good work.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Similar to 어쨌든 but slightly more casual; wraps up a discussion definitively.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example: 우리 집에 개가 한 마리 있어요.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: We have one dog at our house.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Counter: 마리 (for animals). Diminutive: 강아지 (puppy). Related: 개짓다 (to bark), 개밥 (dog food).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The cat is sleeping on the sofa.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Casual: 냥이. Onomatopoeia: 야옹 (meow). Collocations: 고양이 귀 (cat ears/shape).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A bird is singing on top of the tree.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native word (also means 'new' in other contexts). Species: 참새 (sparrow), 독수리 (eagle).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I caught a fish in the river.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Literally: 물 (water) + 고기 (meat). 생선 refers to fish as food at market. Counter: 마리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The rabbit is eating a carrot.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Folklore: 달토끼 (moon rabbit) makes rice cakes. Collocations: 토끼처럼 빠르다 (fast as a rabbit).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example: 산에서 곰을 보면 절대 뛰면 안 돼요.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: If you see a bear on the mountain, you must never run.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean mythology: 단군신화 (Dangun myth). Colloquial: slow or clumsy person.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Long ago, tigers lived in the mountains.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Symbol of Korea. Proverb: 호랑이도 제 말 하면 온다 (speak of the devil). Zodiac animal.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: They say the lion is the king of animals.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native word. Not to confuse with 사자 (四字, four characters in 사자성어). Collocations: 사자 수컷 (male lion).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: An elephant's nose (trunk) is really long.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Related to 코 (nose). Native formation. Collocations: 코끼리 등 (elephant's back).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The monkey eats bananas up in the tree.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Zodiac animal: 원숭이띠 (year of monkey). Collocations: 원숭이처럼 재빠르다 (agile as monkey).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Many people are afraid of snakes.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native word. Zodiac animal. Species: 독사 (venomous snake). Metaphor: treacherous person.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The turtle walks slowly.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Base form: 거북 + diminutive suffix 이. Folk tale: 토끼와 거북이 (tortoise and hare). Slow symbol.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I saw a mouse in the kitchen!
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: First zodiac animal: 쥐띠. Specific: 생쥐 (house mouse). Related: 쥐약 (rat poison).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I tried riding a horse on Jeju Island.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Homophone: 말 (speech/words). Context matters. Related: 경마 (horse racing), 말 키우다 (raise horses).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: If you go to the countryside, there are many cows.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Premium: 한우 (Korean beef cattle). Food: 소고기 (beef). Zodiac: 소띠 (year of ox).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The pig is playing in the mud.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Food: 돼지고기 (pork). Culture: dreaming of pig = lucky omen (wealth). Zodiac: 돼지띠.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The chicken crowed in the morning.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Meat: 닭고기 (chicken). Fried: 치킨 (Korean fried chicken). Silent ㄹ before consonants.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Ducks are swimming in the park pond.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Meat: 오리고기 (duck). Sound: 꽥꽥 (quack). Popular Korean dish.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example: 잠이 안 올 때 양을 세요.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: When you can't sleep, count sheep.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Polysemy: also means 'amount' or 'Western' (洋). Meat: 양고기 (lamb/mutton). Zodiac: 양띠.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: In spring, many pretty butterflies fly around.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Related: 나비넥타이 (bow tie, butterfly necktie). Poetic symbol in Korean literature.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Bees collect honey from flowers.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Polysemy: also means 'punishment'. Specific: 꿀벌 (honeybee). Related: 벌집 (beehive).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The ants are walking in a line.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Idiom: 개미처럼 일하다 (work like an ant = work very hard). Collocations: 개미떼 (swarm of ants).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The spider is spinning a web.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Related: 거미줄 (spider web). Pronunciation caution: similar to 거북이. Collocations: 거미집 (spider's nest).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: In summer, there are too many mosquitoes.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Verb: 모기에 물리다 (to be bitten by mosquito). Related: 모기향 (mosquito-repellent incense).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I'm resting under a tree.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Also means 'wood' (material). Related: 나뭇잎 (tree leaf, ㅅ liaison). Collocations: 나무를 심다 (plant a tree).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I gave flowers as a gift to my girlfriend.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Counter: 송이 (for flowers). Related: 꽃집 (flower shop), 꽃다발 (bouquet). ㅊ silent before consonants.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The children are running and playing on the grass.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Polysemy: also means 'glue'. Related: 풀밭 (grassy field), 풀 뽑다 (pull grass). Also: 풀숲 (grass grove).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: In autumn, the leaves turn red.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native word. Compounds: 나뭇잎 (tree leaf), 잎사귀 (literary form). Counter: 장.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I went to the mountain with friends on the weekend.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Activity: 등산 (hiking/mountain climbing), very popular in Korea. Related: 산책 (walk).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I rode a bicycle along the Han River.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Famous: 한강 (Han River, Seoul). Related: 강변 (riverside), 강물 (river water). Collocations: 강을 건너다.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I want to go to the sea in summer.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Culturally important (peninsula). Related: 해변 (beach), 바닷가 (seaside).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The lake is really beautiful.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean: 湖 (lake) + 水 (water). Related: 호숫가 (lakeside). Counter for lakes.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Jeju Island is the largest island in Korea.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Korea has 3,000+ islands. Related: 무인도 (uninhabited island), 섬사람 (islander).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: It's hard to find water in the desert.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean: 沙 (sand) + 漠 (vast). Related: 사막화 (desertification). Uncommon in Korea.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Walking in the forest makes you feel better.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Activity: 산림욕 (forest bathing), wellness trend. Related: 숲속 (inside forest).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The sky is really clear today.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Related: 하늘색 (sky blue), 하늘하늘 (fluttery). Poetic: can mean heaven.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The ground is wet because it rained.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Also means land/territory. Related: 땅속 (underground), 땅콩 (peanut, ground nut).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I picked up a pretty stone from the river.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Also means first birthday celebration (돌잔치). Related: 돌담 (stone wall), 돌탑 (stone pagoda).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The children are making a castle out of sand.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Related: 모래사장 (sandy beach), 모래시계 (hourglass, sand clock).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The waves are really high today.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean origin. Activity: 파도타기 (surfing). Collocations: 파도 소리 (sound of waves).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: You can hear the refreshing sound of water from the waterfall.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean: 瀑 (waterfall) + 布 (spread). Famous: Cheonjeyeon Falls. Related: 폭포수 (waterfall water).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A rainbow appeared after the rain stopped.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean unique formation. Related: 무지개색 (rainbow colors), 무지갯빛 (iridescent).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I bought one red rose.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Counter: 송이 (for flowers). Related: 장미꽃 (emphasizes flower part). Color: 빨간 장미 (red rose).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Sunflowers always look toward the sun.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Poetic etymology: 해 (sun) + 바라기 (one who gazes at). Metaphor in Korean poetry.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Let's go see cherry blossoms in spring.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Season: spring viewing. Cultural: 벚꽃 놀이 (cherry blossom festival). Famous: Yeouido Park.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The autumn leaves on the mountain are really pretty.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Season: fall. Activity: 단풍놀이 (autumn leaf viewing). Famous spots: Seoraksan, Naejangsan.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The children want to go to the zoo.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean: 動 (animal) + 物 (thing) + 園 (garden). Seoul Grand Park has a major zoo.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I watched a dolphin show at the aquarium.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean: 水 (water) + 族 (group) + 館 (building). Also: 아쿠아리움 (loanword).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I want to raise a pet.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Modern preference: 반려동물 (companion animal). Reflects attitude shift toward pet care. Related: 애완동물 용품 (pet supplies).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I walk the puppy every evening.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Causative form: 산책 (walk) + 시키다 (to make someone do). Related: 산책 나가다 (go for a walk).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: An eagle is flying high in the sky.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Large bird of prey. Variant: 대머리 독수리 (bald eagle). Symbolizes strength and freedom.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A crow is sitting on the power line.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Culture: morning crow = bad omen in superstition. Sound: 까악까악 (caw). Related: 까마귀 무리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Sparrows are eating bread crumbs.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Very common in Korea. Proverb: 참새가 방앗간을 그냥 지나랴 (sparrow can't resist grain mill/temptation).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: There are too many pigeons in the park.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Common urban bird. 평화의 비둘기 (dove of peace). Many find urban pigeons a nuisance.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The parrot imitates human speech.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean: 鸚鵡. Idiom: 앵무새처럼 따라 하다 (to repeat like a parrot). Collocations: 앵무새 말 (parrot speech).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Penguins can't fly but they swim well.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Loanword from English. Very popular as cute character in Korean media and merchandise.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I saw a whale in the sea near Jeju Island.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Proverb: 고래 싸움에 새우 등 터진다 (when whales fight, shrimp's back breaks = innocents suffer). Jeju whale tours.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The dolphin jumped out of the water.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Etymology: 돌 (spinning) + 고래 (whale). Jeju known for wild dolphin sightings. Collocations: 돌고래 쇼 (dolphin show).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Sharks are scary but cool animals.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Cultural: 아기상어 (Baby Shark) viral song. Collocations: 상어지느러미 (shark fin).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: An octopus has eight legs.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Polysemy: also means 'written language' (文語). Delicacy: 산낙지 (live small octopus). Counter: 마리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I caught a small crab at the beach.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Premium: 꽃게 (blue crab). Dish: 간장게장 (soy marinated crab) called 밥도둑 (rice thief).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I've seen a deer on the mountain.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Related: 사슴벌레 (stag beetle). Korea tourism: Nara Deer Park is popular Japan destination.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Foxes are very smart animals.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Mythology: 구미호 (nine-tailed fox) shapeshifter. Idiom: 여우같다 (crafty/sly).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Wolves appear often in old stories.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Compound: 늑대인간 (werewolf). Idiom: 양의 탈을 쓴 늑대 (wolf in sheep's clothing).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A squirrel is eating acorns up in the tree.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Idiom: 다람쥐 챗바퀴 돌듯 (like squirrel wheel = repetitive busy life). Related: 도토리 (acorn).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Bats are animals that are active at night.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Folklore: seen as two-faced. Idiom: 박쥐같다 (indecisive/double-faced). Nocturnal.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Dragonflies fly around a lot in autumn.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Polysemy: also means 'sleeping spot/bed'. Red dragonfly 고추잠자리 is autumn symbol in Korea.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A ladybug landed on my hand.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Compound: 무당 (shaman) + 벌레 (insect). Bright colors resemble shaman outfit. Considered lucky.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example: 비가 온 후에 지렁이가 땅 위로 나와요.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Earthworms come above ground after it rains.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Proverb: 지렁이도 밟으면 꿈틀한다 (even earthworm writhes when stepped on = even meek have limits).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: You need to be careful of jellyfish at the beach in summer.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Verb: 해파리에 쏘이다 (to be stung by jellyfish). Beaches post summer warnings.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Today's Korean class was fun.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Collocations: 수업을 듣다 (take a class), 수업을 하다 (teach). Counter: 시간 (hour).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I haven't finished all my homework yet.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Collocations: 숙제를 하다 (do homework), 숙제를 내다 (assign homework). Culture: significant in Korean education.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example: 다음 주에 시험이 있어서 공부해야 돼요.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I have to study because there's an exam next week.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Collocations: 시험을 보다 (take a test), 시험을 치르다 (formal variant). Culture: crucial in Korea.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: My grades went up a lot this semester.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Related: 성적표 (report card). Sino-Korean: 成 (accomplish) + 績 (achievement). Very important culturally.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Please open your textbook to page 30.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 教 (teach) + 科 (subject) + 書 (book). Related: 참고서 (reference book).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I wrote down the important content in my notebook.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Also called 노트 (loanword, more common now). Traditional term: 공책. Counter: 권 (for books/notebooks).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example: 연필로 먼저 쓰고 나중에 펜으로 써요.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: First write with pencil, then later write with pen.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 鉛 (lead) + 筆 (writing tool). Related: 색연필 (colored pencil). Counter: 자루.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Can you lend me just one ballpoint pen?
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Loanword: 볼 (ball) + 펜 (pen). Formal writing uses 검정 볼펜 (black ballpoint). Counter: 자루.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I erased the wrong part with an eraser.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: From verb 지우다 (erase) + -개 (tool suffix). For pen: 화이트 (white-out). Counter: 개.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The teacher is writing on the blackboard.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Modern schools use 화이트보드 (whiteboard) or 스마트보드 (smart board). Culture: chalkboards less common now.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Please cut the paper with scissors.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Same word as scissors in 가위바위보 (rock-paper-scissors). Related: 가위눌림 (sleep paralysis).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I'm gluing the paper with glue.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Homophone: 풀 (grass). Type: 딱풀 (glue stick, most common). Related: 풀칠하다 (to glue).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Please give me just one sheet of paper.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Counter: 장 (sheet). Traditional: 한지 (Korean paper, very durable). Related: 종이접기 (paper folding).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I do my homework on the computer.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Loanword from English. 노트북 = laptop (not notebook). PC방 = Korean internet cafe (hugely popular).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I printed the report with the printer.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Verbs: 출력하다/인쇄하다 (to print). 프린트 means both printer and printout.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The classroom is on the third floor.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 教 (teach) + 室 (room). Korean schools number from 1 (not ground floor).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: If you review every day, your skills improve.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 復 (again) + 習 (study). Opposite: 예습 (preview). Common study method pair.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I previewed the content we'll learn tomorrow.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 豫 (beforehand) + 習 (study). Phrase: 예습과 복습 (preview and review together).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I have to give a presentation in class tomorrow.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Verb: 발표하다 (present/announce). Related: 발표 자료 (presentation materials), 발표자 (presenter).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example: 오늘 수업에서 환경 문제에 대해 토론했어요.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: We discussed environmental issues in class today.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Verb: 토론하다 (discuss/debate). Related: 토론 대회 (debate competition).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: If you have a question, please raise your hand.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Verb: 질문하다 (ask a question). Phrase: 질문 있으세요? (Do you have any questions?)

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I couldn't answer the teacher's question.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Verb: 대답하다 (answer). Related: 정답 (correct answer), 오답 (wrong answer).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The teacher explained the grammar easily for us.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Verb: 설명하다 (explain). Related: 설명서 (instruction manual), 설명회 (briefing session).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Can you understand this sentence?
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: More natural: 이해가 되다. Related: 이해력 (comprehension ability). Native speaker usage pattern.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Memorizing Chinese characters is the hardest.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Formal synonym: 암기하다. Phrase: 외워야 할 것이 많아요 (lots to memorize).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Please translate this sentence into English.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 번역 = written translation. 통역 = spoken interpretation. Related: 번역가 (translator).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I practice pronunciation every day.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Noun: 연습 (practice). Related: 연습장 (practice notebook), 연습 경기 (practice match).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The answer is wrong. Please try again.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Often confused with 다르다 (to be different). 틀리다 = error; 다르다 = simply different.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Yes, that's correct! It's the right answer.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Also means 'to fit' or 'to be hit'. 맞아요 is most common Korean affirmation response.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: My test score is 90 points.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 點 (point) + 數 (number). Related: 만점 (perfect score).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I'm really happy that I passed the exam.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Verb: 합격하다 (pass). Opposite: 불합격 (fail). Colloquial: 떨어지다 (fall).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Unfortunately, I failed this time.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 不 (not) + 合 (fit) + 格 (standard). Colloquial: 떨어지다 (to fail).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I graduate from university next year.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Verb: 졸업하다 (graduate). Related: 졸업식 (graduation ceremony), 졸업장 (diploma).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I enroll in elementary school in March.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 入 (enter) + 學 (study). Korean school year starts in March, not September.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I'm taking 5 subjects this semester.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Two semesters in Korea: 1학기 (March-June), 2학기 (September-December).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: What are you going to do during vacation?
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Types: 여름 방학 (summer), 겨울 방학 (winter). Verb: 방학하다 (go on break).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: My favorite subject is math.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 科 (subject) + 目 (item). Related: 필수 과목 (required), 선택 과목 (elective).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I'm solving math problems.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 數 (number) + 學 (study). Related: 수학자 (mathematician). Important subject in Korea.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Doing science experiments is fun.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 科 (branch) + 學 (study). Related: 과학자 (scientist), 과학관 (science museum).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I'm very interested in Korean history.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 歷 (pass through) + 史 (history). Related: 역사적 (historical), 한국사 (Korean history).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I study English every day.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 英 (Britain) + 語 (language). Hugely important; English education is major industry in Korea.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: It's been one year since I started learning Korean.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 한국 (Korea) + 어 (語, language). TOPIK is official proficiency test. Collocations: 한국어를 배우다.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: We sang songs during music class.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 音 (sound) + 樂 (music). Also means 'music' generally. Related: 음악가 (musician).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: We painted watercolors during art class.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 美 (beauty) + 術 (skill/art). Related: 미술관 (art museum), 미술가 (artist).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: We played soccer during P.E. class.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 體 (body) + 育 (nurture). Related: 체육관 (gymnasium), 체육대회 (sports day).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I take notes diligently during class.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Verb: 필기하다 (take notes). Related: 필기시험 (written exam), 필기구 (writing instruments).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Memorizing English words is hard.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: More formal than 외우다. Sino-Korean: 暗 (dark) + 記 (record) = learning by heart.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Korean grammar is very different from English.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 文 (writing) + 法 (rule/method). Korean is SOV language. Very systematic.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I memorize 10 words a day.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 單 (single) + 語 (word). Related: 단어장 (vocabulary notebook), 어휘 (broader vocabulary).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: My Korean pronunciation has improved a lot.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Verb: 발음하다 (pronounce). Korean has rules: 연음 (liaison), 경음화 (tensification).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The listening test is the hardest.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: From 듣다 (listen). One of four TOPIK skills. Related: 듣기 평가 (listening assessment).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I want to practice speaking a lot.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: From 말하다 (speak). Often most challenging for learners. Related: 말하기 대회 (speech contest).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: My reading speed is gradually getting faster.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: From 읽다 (read). Related: 읽기 자료 (reading material). ㄹ silent in pronunciation (익다).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I haven't finished my writing homework yet.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: From 쓰다 (write). Also TOPIK section. Related: 글쓰기 (writing composition).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I take Korean conversation classes every week.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 會 (meet) + 話 (speech). Related: 영어 회화 (English conversation), 회화 학원 (conversation academy).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: This problem is too difficult.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Collocations: 문제를 풀다 (solve problem), 문제집 (workbook/problem set).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: They give a prize if you get the correct answer.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 正 (correct) + 答 (answer). Related: 정답률 (accuracy rate). Opposite: 오답.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I make a wrong-answer notebook and review it.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 오답 노트 popular Korean study method. Sino-Korean: 誤 (wrong) + 答 (answer).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The teacher handed out the model answers.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Students compare their answers to 모범답안 after exams. Important for learning.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: If you cheat on the test, you get a zero.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Konglish from 'cunning.' Formal: 부정행위 (academic dishonesty). Serious in Korea.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I received a scholarship because my grades were good.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 獎 (award) + 學 (study) + 金 (money). Types: 전액 (full), 반액 (half).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Korean university tuition is very expensive.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Major social issue in Korea. Sine-Korean: 登 (register) + 錄 (record) + 金 (money).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I received a business degree from university.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 學 (study) + 位 (rank). Types: 학사 (bachelor's), 석사 (master's), 박사 (doctorate).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I'm researching Korean in a master's program.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 碩 (great) + 士 (scholar). Takes ~2 years in Korea. Related: 석사 논문 (thesis).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: It took 5 years to get my doctorate.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 博 (broad/extensive) + 士 (scholar). 박사님 honorific. Highly respected in Korea.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I go to work at 8 a.m. every morning.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 出 (go out) + 勤 (work). Related: 출근길 (commute to work), 출근 시간 (work start time).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I left work early today.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 退 (retreat) + 勤 (work). Related: 퇴근 시간 (quitting time). Opposite: 출근.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: There's a meeting at 2 p.m.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 會 (meet) + 議 (discuss). Related: 회의실 (meeting room), 화상 회의 (video conference).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I have to submit the report by tomorrow.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 報 (report) + 告 (tell) + 書 (document). Verb: 보고하다 (report).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Please check your email.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Collocations: 이메일을 보내다 (send), 이메일을 받다 (receive).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: A phone call came from the client.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Native Korean. Collocations: 전화하다 (make call), 전화를 받다 (answer phone).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: We exchange business cards when meeting for the first time.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 名 (name) + 銜 (title). Cultural: give/receive with both hands in Korean business.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The salary comes in on the 25th.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 月 (month) + 給 (pay). Related: 월급날 (payday). Most Korean companies pay monthly.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I received a bonus at the end of the year.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Also: 상여금 (formal). Timing: Lunar New Year, Chuseok bonuses common.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm going to take vacation next month.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Collocations: 휴가를 내다 (submit vacation request). Related: 연차 (annual leave days).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm going on a business trip to Busan next week.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 出 (go out) + 張 (extend). Related: 해외 출장 (overseas business trip).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example: 이번 주에 야근을 세 번이나 했어요.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I worked overtime three times this week.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 夜 (night) + 勤 (work). Work culture issue; reform efforts ongoing in Korea.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I eat lunch together with my colleagues.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 同 (same) + 僚 (companion). Phrase: 직장 동료 (work colleague).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I showed the report to my boss.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 上 (above) + 司 (manage). Honorific language essential when speaking to 상사.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I entrusted the work to my subordinate.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 部 (part) + 下 (below). More natural: 후배 (junior) in daily speech.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The team leader led the meeting.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword: 팀 (team) + Sino-Korean: 長 (chief). Always address as 팀장님 (honorific).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The CEO is on a business trip today.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 社 (company) + 長 (chief) + 님 (honorific). For company owner or top executive.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm nervous because I have an interview tomorrow.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 面 (face) + 接 (meet). Related: 면접관 (interviewer), 면접을 보다 (have interview).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I submitted my resume online.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 履 (career) + 歷 (history) + 書 (document). Also required: 자기소개서 (self-introduction).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I got a job after graduating from university.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 就 (approach) + 職 (job). Verb: 취직하다. Related: 취업 (broader employment concept).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: My father is retiring next year.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 退 (retreat) + 職 (job). Related: 퇴직금 (severance pay), 정년퇴직 (mandatory retirement).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I got promoted by working hard.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 昇 (rise) + 進 (advance). Verb: 승진하다 (get promoted). Cultural: very important.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I was fired because the company situation was bad.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Verb: 해고하다 (fire), 해고당하다 (be fired). Related: 정리해고 (layoff).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I signed the contract.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Related: 계약서 (contract document), 계약직 (contract worker), 정규직 (permanent position).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm busy because the deadline is tomorrow.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Related: 마감일 (deadline date), 마감하다 (close/finalize). Time pressure concept.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: We started a new project.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Shortened: 프로젝 (casual). Related: 프로젝트 관리 (project management).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm an office worker.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 會 (company) + 社 (firm) + 員 (member). Broader: 직장인 (any employed person).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: That person is a famous entrepreneur.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 事 (matter) + 業 (business) + 家 (expert). Verb: 사업을 하다 (run business).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm working as a freelancer.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Growing field in Korea, especially IT and creative industries.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I worked part-time at a cafe when I was a college student.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: From German 'Arbeit.' Shortened: 알바 (very common). Related: 알바생 (part-time worker).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I worked as an intern in the summer.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Related: 인턴십 (internship). Many Korean companies have structured programs.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I negotiated my annual salary.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 年 (year) + 俸 (salary). Stated before tax in Korea. Related: 실수령액 (take-home).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: This company has good benefits.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 福 (fortune) + 祉 (welfare). Related: 복리후생 (formal term for employee benefits).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Working hours are from 9 to 6.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 勤 (work) + 務 (duty). Related: 유연 근무제 (flexible working hours).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Shall we eat together during lunch break?
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Typically 12:00-1:00 in Korean offices. Common bonding time for colleagues.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: There's a team dinner this evening.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 會 (gather) + 食 (eat). Cultural significance declining among younger workers in Korea.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Work stress has been severe lately.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Collocations: 스트레스를 받다 (feel stressed), 스트레스를 풀다 (relieve).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I achieved good results this year.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 成 (accomplish) + 果 (result). Related: 성과급 (performance-based bonus).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I achieved this quarter's goal.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 目 (eye) + 標 (mark). Collocations: 목표를 세우다 (set goal). Very important culturally.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm organizing the documents.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 書 (writing) + 類 (type). Related: 서류 가방 (briefcase), 서류 작업 (paperwork).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Please make 10 copies of this document.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Verb: 복사하다 (photocopy). Related: 복사기 (photocopier). Very common office task.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Please send the documents by fax.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Still used in many Korean offices, especially government and traditional businesses.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm giving a presentation to the client tomorrow.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Shortened: PT (피티) in office slang. PPT (피피티) = PowerPoint slides.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: We're carrying out the project in cooperation with another team.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 協 (together) + 力 (power). Related: 협력하다 (cooperate), 협력업체 (partner company).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Competition is fierce in the job market these days.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 競 (compete) + 爭 (struggle). Related: 경쟁력 (competitiveness), 경쟁자 (competitor).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: If office supplies are running low, tell the general affairs team.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Includes pens, paper, stapler, etc. Related: 문구류 (stationery). Sino-Korean: 事 + 務 + 用 + 品.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The copier broke down, so I requested a repair.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Also: 복합기 (multifunction device: print, scan, fax). Common office equipment issue.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I scan documents with the scanner and send them by email.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Verb: 스캔하다 (scan). Often integrated in multifunction machines.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example: 공유 캘린더에 회의 일정을 넣어 주세요.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Please put the meeting schedule on the shared calendar.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Refers to digital calendars usually. Traditional: 달력 (physical calendar). Very important for scheduling.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: An announcement was posted on the bulletin board.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Also refers to online forums/boards. Related: 게시글 (post). Digital and physical versions common.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I always wear a name tag at work.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 名 (name) + 札 (tag/label). Collocations: 명찰을 달다 (wear name tag). Required at many workplaces.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: They check attendance every morning.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 出 (appear) + 席 (seat). Related: 출석부 (attendance sheet), 출석률 (attendance rate).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I was late today because I missed the bus.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Verb: 지각하다 (be late). Related: 지각 사유서 (late excuse form). Taken seriously in Korean workplaces.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I left early because I wasn't feeling well.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 早 (early) + 退 (retreat). Requires supervisor approval in most Korean workplaces.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I was absent from work today because I was sick.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 缺 (lack) + 勤 (work). 무단결근 (unauthorized absence) can lead to disciplinary action.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: There's a team workshop next week.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Often outside office for team building, training, social activities.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm attending a marketing seminar this afternoon.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Collocations: 세미나에 참석하다 (attend). Related: 세미나실 (seminar room).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: We brainstormed for the new project.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Common in Korean creative and marketing teams. Verb: 브레인스토밍하다.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The teamwork was really great on this project.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Koreans value group harmony and collaboration; 팀워크 highly valued.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The project succeeded thanks to the team leader's leadership.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Increasingly valued alongside seniority in Korean companies.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I've grown a lot at this company.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 成 (become) + 長 (long/grow). Verb: 성장하다. Used for personal, company, economic growth.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I was assigned to plan a new product.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 企 (plan) + 劃 (mark/plan). Related: 기획하다 (plan), 기획팀 (planning team), 기획서 (proposal).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The budget for this project is insufficient.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 豫 (beforehand) + 算 (calculate). Collocations: 예산을 세우다 (set budget), 예산 초과 (over budget).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example: 이번 달 매출이 지난달보다 많이 올랐어요.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: This month's sales went up a lot compared to last month.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 賣 (sell) + 出 (out). Related: 매출액 (sales revenue amount), 매출 목표 (sales target).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm planning to invest in that company.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 投 (throw) + 資 (resources). Related: 투자하다 (invest), 투자자 (investor), 주식 투자 (stock investment).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I clean my room every weekend.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native verb: 청 (clean) + 소 (sweep). Related: 청소기 (vacuum), 청결 (cleanliness). Common: 청소를 하다/청소를 하며.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The weather is nice, so I'm doing laundry.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native verb: 빨 (wash clothes) + 래 (suffix). Related: 빨래 (laundry), 빨래방 (laundromat). Related: 세탁하다, 빨다 (to wash).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I do the dishes after dinner.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 설거지기 (dish soap), 설거지통 (dish basin). Common: 설거지를 하다/먹고 설거지해요.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Today I'm cooking.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 要理. Sino-related: 요리사 (chef), 요리책 (cookbook). Compare to: 밥하다 (to cook/make rice meal).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I iron my shirt before going to work.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native compound: 다림(iron) + 질(action). Related: 다리미 (iron-tool), 다림판 (ironing board). Conjugation: 다림질해요 (present).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I sweep the yard with a broom.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native verb (irregular). Conjugation: 쓸다→쓸어요/쓸었어요. Related: 청소 (cleaning), 빗자루 (broom). Common: 바닥을 쓸다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I wipe the table clean.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native verb. Related uses: 이를 닦다 (brush teeth), 구두를 닦다 (polish shoes), 테이블을 닦다 (wipe table). 깨끗하게 닦아요 is common.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I'm tidying up the desk.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 整理 (organize). Sino-related: 정리장 (storage), 정리 정돈 (tidying up). Broader verb than 청소 (cleaning).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: In Korea, you must do recycling.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 分離 (separate) + 收 (collect) + 去 (dispose). Related: 분리수거장 (recycling center), 재활용 (recycling). Korean cultural note: strict rules by material type.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Please throw away the trash.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 쓰레기통 (trash can), 음식물 쓰레기 (food waste), 생활쓰레기 (household waste). Common: 쓰레기를 버리다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Where is the trash can?
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native compound: 쓰레기 (trash) + 통 (bin). Related: 분리수거통, 재활용 쓰레기통. Common: 쓰레기통을 비우다 (empty trash).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: We ran out of detergent.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 洗劑 (washing agent). Sino-related: 주방 세제 (dish soap), 세탁 세제 (laundry detergent), 섬유유연제 (fabric softener).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I wash my hands well with soap.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 손비누 (hand soap), 물비누 (liquid soap), 비누 거품 (soap bubbles). Common: 손을 비누로 씻다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: This shampoo smells nice.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword (English 'shampoo'). Related: 린스/트리트먼트 (conditioner), 샴푸통 (shampoo bottle). Common: 샴푸로 머리를 감다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I'll bring a new towel.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 손수건 (handkerchief), 타올 (towel). Compounds: 수건을 말리다 (dry towel). Can also use 타올/타올.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I squeeze toothpaste onto the toothbrush.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 齒藥 (tooth medicine). Related: 칫솔 (toothbrush), 치약 짜기 (squeezing toothpaste). Common: 치약을 짜다, 양치질하다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I change my toothbrush every 3 months.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 齒 (tooth) + 솔 (brush). Related: 전동 칫솔 (electric toothbrush), 치약 (toothpaste). Common: 칫솔질하다 (to brush teeth).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I get dressed while looking in the mirror.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 거울을 보다 (look in mirror), 손거울 (hand mirror), 전신거울 (full-length mirror). Common: 거울을 보고 옷을 입다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I comb my hair with a comb.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Verb 빗다 (to comb) shares root. Related: 머리를 빗다 (comb hair), 빗질하다 (combing). Common: 빗으로 머리를 빗어요.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I dry my hair with a hair dryer after showering.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword: 드라이 (dry) + 기 (machine). Related: 헤어드라이어, 찬바람/따뜻한바람. Common: 머리를 드라이기로 말리다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I put the laundry in the washing machine.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 洗濯 (laundry) + 機 (machine). Related: 건조기 (dryer), 세탁실 (laundry room). Common: 세탁기를 돌리다 (run washing machine).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Please put the milk in the refrigerator.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 冷 (cold) + 藏 (storage) + 庫 (warehouse). Related: 냉동실 (freezer), 냉동고 (deep freezer). Common: 냉장고에 넣다/꺼내다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I heat up rice in the microwave.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 電子 (electronic) + 영어 레인지. Shorter: 전자렌지, 레인지. Related: 데우다 (warm), 데워먹다 (reheat). Common: 데운 음식.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: It's too hot, so I turn on the air conditioner.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword (English 'air conditioner'). Related: 냉방 (cooling), 실외기 (outdoor unit). Common: 에어컨을 켜다/끄다, 온도를 내리다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: A heater is essential in winter.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword (English 'heater'). Related: 난방 (heating system), 온풍기 (space heater). Common: 히터를 켜다, 겨울 필수용품.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: It's cool when I turn on the fan.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native compound: 선 (select/fan) + 풍 (wind) + 기 (machine). Related: 선풍기를 틀다 (turn on). Common: 여름 필수, 선풍기 바람.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I turn on the light when I enter the room.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 電 (electricity) + 燈 (lamp). Related: 형광등 (fluorescent), LED 전등. Common: 전등을 켜다/끄다, 불을 켜다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I plug the charger into the outlet.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword (Dutch/German 'konzentration'). Related: 멀티탭 (power strip), 어댑터 (adapter). Common: 콘센트에 꽂다, 플러그를 끼우다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I change the channel with the remote control.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword (English 'remote control'). Related: TV 리모컨, 에어컨 리모컨. Common: 리모컨으로 채널을 바꾸다, 볼륨을 조정하다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I put the key in my bag.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word (from 열다 open + 쇠 metal). Related: 카드키 (key card), 열쇠고리 (keyring). Common: 열쇠를 잃어버리다, 열쇠를 잠그다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I locked the lock on the door.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native compound: 자물 (lock) + 쇠 (metal). Related: 열쇠 (key), 잠금 (locking). Common: 자물쇠를 잠그다, 자물쇠를 따다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: It's cold, so please cover yourself with a blanket.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 이불을 덮다 (cover with blanket), 이불을 개다 (fold blanket). Common: 이불이 따뜻해요, 여름 이불.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: This pillow is very comfortable.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 베개를 베다 (rest on pillow), 베개 커버. Common: 편한 베개, 높은/낮은 베개.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I lie on the bed and read a book.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 寢 (sleep) + 台 (platform/bed). Related: 침대 밑 (under bed), 침대보 (bed sheet). Common: 이층 침대 (bunk bed).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I sit on the sofa and watch TV.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword (English 'sofa'). Related: 소파에 누워있다 (lie on sofa), 소파 쿠션. Common: 소파에 앉다/누워있다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: There is a laptop on the desk.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 冊 (book) + 床 (platform/table). Related: 책상 위 (on desk), 책상 다리 (desk leg). Compare: 탁자 (table), 식탁 (dining table).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Please have a seat.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 椅 (chair) + 子 (object). Related: 흔들의자 (rocking chair), 의자에 앉다. Common: 의자를 나란히 놓다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: There is a pen in the drawer.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 서랍장 (chest of drawers), 서랍 안/밖. Common: 서랍을 열다/닫다, 서랍에서 꺼내다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I take clothes out of the wardrobe.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 衣 (clothes) + 장 (cabinet). Related: 옷 (clothes), 붙박이 옷장 (built-in). Common: 옷장에서 꺼내다, 옷장 정리.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I open the curtains in the morning.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword (English 'curtain'). Related: 블라인드 (blinds), 레이스 커튼. Common: 커튼을 열다/치다, 커튼을 닫다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I laid a carpet in the living room.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword (English 'carpet'). Related: 러그 (rug), 깔개 (mat). Common: 카펫을 깔다, 카펫을 청소하다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I water the flowerpot.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 花 (flower) + 盆 (pot). Related: 화분에 물을 주다 (water plant), 식물 (plant). Common: 거실에 화분을 놓다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I put the family photo in a picture frame.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 額 (frame/front) + 字 (character). Related: 사진 액자 (photo frame), 그림 액자. Common: 액자를 걸다, 벽에 붙이다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: A clock is hanging on the wall.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 時 (time) + 計 (device). Related: 벽시계 (wall clock), 손목시계 (wristwatch). Common: 시계를 보다, 시간 확인.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I write appointments on the calendar.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 月 (month) + 曆 (calendar). Related: 탁상 달력 (desk calendar), 벽 달력. Common: 달력에 적다, 일정을 표시하다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I open the window in the morning to ventilate.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 換 (exchange) + 気 (air). Related: 환기하다 (ventilate), 공기 (air). Cultural: 중요한 습관, 겨울 결로 방지.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The window screen is torn, so mosquitoes are getting in.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 防蟲 (insect-proof) + 網 (net). Related: 창문 (window), 방충 (insect-proof). Korean homes essential in summer.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The drain is clogged, so the water won't go down.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 排水 (drain water) + 口 (opening). Related: 배수 (drainage), 씽크대 (sink). Common: 배수구가 막히다, 배관공 (plumber).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Water is leaking from the faucet.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 水道 (water supply) + 꼭지 (spout). Related: 수도 (water), 꼭지 (faucet). Common: 수도꼭지를 잠그다 (turn off).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The light bulb burned out, so I need to replace it.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 電 (electricity) + 球 (ball). Related: LED 전구, 백열전구 (incandescent). Common: 전구를 갈다 (change bulb), 나가다 (burn out).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The remote control batteries are dead.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 乾電 (dry electric) + 池 (pool). Related: 충전지 (rechargeable), AA 건전지. Common: 건전지가 다 되다 (dead battery).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I sealed the box with tape.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword (English 'tape'). Related: 스카치테이프, 박스테이프, 묶음테이프. Common: 테이프로 붙이다, 붙이고 때리다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: You need a hammer to drive a nail into the wall.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 못 (nail), 망치질하다 (hammering). Common: 망치로 못을 박다, 벽에 못을 박다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Please tighten the screw with a screwdriver.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword (English 'screwdriver'). Related: 십자 드라이버, 일자 드라이버. Common: 나사를 조이다/풀다, 조립 가구.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I hammered a nail into the wall and hung a picture frame.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word (not confused with adverb 못). Related: 못을 박다 (drive nail), 압정 (thumbtack). Common: 벽에 못을 박다, 액자를 걸다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The screw came loose, so I need to tighten it again.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 나사를 조이다 (tighten), 나사가 빠지다 (colloquial: screw loose). Common: 조립 가구 만들 때 필요.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I painted the room walls with white paint.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword (English 'paint'). Related: 페인트칠 (painting), 붓 (brush). Common: 벽을 페인트로 칠하다, DIY 인기.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I'm moving to a new apartment next month.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 移 (move) + 舍 (house). Related: 이삿짐센터 (moving company), 집들이 (housewarming). Common: 다음 달에 이사해요.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I did the interior design of the new house myself.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword (English 'interior design'). Related: 셀프 인테리어 (DIY), 인테리어 업체. Korean trend: home renovation shows.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I ordered furniture online.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 家 (home) + 具 (tool/furniture). Related: 가구점 (furniture store), 조립 가구 (flat-pack). Common: 온라인으로 가구를 주문하다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example: 수납 공간이 부족해서 정리가 안 돼요.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I can't organize because there's not enough storage space.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 한자어: 收 (collect) + 納 (store). Related: 수납장 (storage cabinet), 수납하다 (store). Korean: 정리 문화에서 중요한 개념.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I mop the floor with a rag.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 물걸레 (wet mop), 마른걸레 (dry cloth), 걸레질하다. Common: 바닥을 걸레로 닦다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: A lot of dust has built up on the fan.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 먼지를 털다 (dust off), 미세먼지 (particulate matter). Korean: 봄 미세먼지 대기질 문제.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Mold has appeared in the bathroom.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 곰팡이가 피다 (mold grows), 곰팡이 제거제. Korean: 습한 여름에 욕실, 부엌에서 흔함.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: There's a bug in my room and I'm scared.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 해충 (pest), 바퀴벌레 (cockroach), 벌레 퇴치. Common: 방에 벌레가 있어요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: The phone is broken.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 電話 (telephone) + 機 (machine). Related: 전화 (call), 전화를 받다 (answer). Compare: 휴대폰 (mobile phone).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I bought a new cell phone.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Konglish: hand (손) + phone. More formal: 휴대폰. Related: 스마트폰, 스마트 기기. Common: 핸드폰을 켜다/끄다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Please tell me your phone number.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 電話 (phone) + 番 (number) + 號 (sign). Korean numbers start with 010. Related: 번호판 (license plate).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I got a text message.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native word (漢字 means Chinese characters, but 문자 means alphabet/text here). Related: 문자 메시지, SMS. Common: 문자를 보내다/받다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I texted my friend.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Verb form. Related: 카톡하다 (KakaoTalk), 메일을 보내다 (email). Casual: 문자할게 (I'll text you).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).english: to be on a call / to talk on the phone
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I'm on a call right now.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 通話 (telephone conversation). Related: 통화 중 (on the phone), 통화료 (call fee). Common: 통화가 끊겼어요 (call dropped).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Please don't hang up.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native verb. Multiple meanings: 전화를 끊다 (hang up), 빵을 끊다 (cut bread). Common: 전화가 끊어졌어요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Please answer the phone.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native verb. Wide use: 전화를 받다 (answer call), 편지를 받다 (receive mail). Common: 전화를 받았어요 (I picked up).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: The ringtone is too loud.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native compound: 벨 (bell) + 소리 (sound). Related: 진동 (vibration mode), 조용히 (silent). Common: 벨소리를 바꾸다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I need to charge my phone.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 充 (fill) + 電 (electricity). Related: 충전 중 (charging), 충전기 (charger). Common: 배터리를 충전하다, 충전됐어요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Did you bring a charger?
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 充電 (charging) + 機 (device). Related: 무선 충전기 (wireless charger), 어댑터. Common: 충전기를 꽂다, 포함되어 있어요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: The battery is almost dead.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'battery'). Related: 배터리가 나가다 (dead), 배터리 용량. Common: 배터리가 빨리 떨어져요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Is there WiFi here?
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (WiFi). Related: 와이파이가 있어요 (WiFi available), 무선인터넷 (wireless internet). Common: 와이파이에 연결하다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I forgot my password.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 秘密 (secret) + 番號 (number). Related: 비밀번호를 잊다 (forget), 비밀번호를 재설정하다. Common: 패턴, PIN.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I created a new account.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 計定 (accounting/setting). Related: 계정을 만들다 (create), 계정을 삭제하다 (delete). Common: 이메일 계정.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I can't log in.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'login'). Related: 로그아웃 (logout), 접속하다 (access). Common: 로그인이 안 돼요 (can't log in).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I searched for it on the internet.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 檢 (inspect) + 索 (search). Related: 검색어 (search term), 검색 결과 (results). Common: 인터넷에서 검색해요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I downloaded this app.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'download'). Related: 다운로드하다, 다운받다 (casual). Common: 파일을 다운로드하다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I uploaded a photo.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'upload'). Related: 업로드하다, 올리다 (casual). Common: 사진/영상을 업로드하다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Let's take a photo together!
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native compound: 사진 (photo) + 찍다 (take). Related: 셀카 (selfie), 스크린샷 (screenshot). Common: 함께 사진을 찍어요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I watched a funny video.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 動 (moving) + 영상 (image/video). Related: 영상 (video), 영화 (movie). Common: 동영상을 보다/찍다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: This app is really convenient.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (short for application). Related: 앱 스토어 (app store), 앱을 깔다 (install). Common: 스마트폰 앱.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I send messages through KakaoTalk.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Korea's dominant messaging app (brand name). Related: 카톡 (abbreviated), 카톡하다 (send KakaoTalk). Cultural: 거의 필수 설치 앱.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I posted a photo on Instagram.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Instagram (brand name). Related: 인스타 (abbreviated), 인스타 계정. Common: 팔로우하다 (follow), 좋아요 (like).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I watch cooking videos on YouTube.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: YouTube (brand name). Related: 유튜버 (YouTuber), 유튜브 채널. Common: 동영상을 유튜브에 올리다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I search for good restaurants on Naver.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Naver (Korean search engine/portal). Related: 네이버 지도 (Naver Maps), 네이버 블로그. Cultural: 구글보다 Naver 사용.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I wrote a travel review on my blog.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'blog'). Related: 블로그 글 (post), 블로그 댓글. Korean: Naver 블로그가 매우 인기.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I left a comment.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native word. Related: 댓글을 달다 (leave comment), 악플 (malicious comment). Common: 댓글을 읽다/쓰다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I got a lot of likes.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native word (from 좋다 to be good). Related: 좋아요 버튼, 좋아요 개수. Common: 좋아요를 누르다 (press like).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I shared this post with my friend.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 共 (together) + 有 (have). Related: 공유 (sharing), 공유 버튼. Common: SNS에 공유하다, 링크를 공유하다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I follow that singer.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'follow'). Related: 팔로워 (follower), 언팔하다 (unfollow). Common: 팔로우하다, 팔로워 수.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I'm getting too many notifications.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native word (from 알리다 to notify). Related: 알림 설정 (notification settings), 알림을 끄다 (turn off). Common: 알림이 왔어요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I change the language in settings.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 設 (set) + 定 (fixed). Related: 설정하다 (configure), 환경설정 (preferences). Common: 소리 설정, 밝기 설정.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I need to update the app.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'update'). Related: 최신 업데이트 (latest update), 업데이트하다. Common: 앱을 업데이트하다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I deleted old photos.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 削 (delete) + 除 (remove). Related: 삭제 (deletion), 완전 삭제 (permanent delete). Common: 파일을 삭제하다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I saved the file.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 貯 (save) + 藏 (store). Related: 저장 (storage), 자동 저장 (auto-save). Common: 파일을 저장하다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I copied the link.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 複 (copy) + 寫 (write). Related: 복사본 (copy), 복사 붙여넣기 (copy-paste). Common: 텍스트를 복사하다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Please paste it here.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native compound: 붙이다 (attach) + 넣기 (putting). Related: 붙여넣다, Ctrl+V. Common: 여기에 붙여넣기 하세요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I sent a cute emoticon.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (emoticon). In Korea means animated stickers, not simple emoji. Related: 이모티콘 팩 (sticker pack). Korean: KakaoTalk 이모티콘 인기.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I took a selfie and posted it.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Konglish: 셀프 (self) + 카메라 (camera). Related: 셀카봉 (selfie stick), 셀카 찍기. Common: 셀카를 찍어서 올리다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example: 데이터를 너무 많이 써서 속도가 느려졌어요.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I used too much data, so the speed slowed down.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'data'). Related: 데이터를 써다 (use data), 무제한 데이터 (unlimited data). Common: 데이터가 떨어졌어요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I want to switch to a cheaper plan.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 要 (rate) + 金 (fee) + 制 (system). Related: 요금 (fee), 요금제를 바꾸다 (change plan). Korean: carriers offer many options.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Which carrier are you using?
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 通信 (communication) + 社 (company). Related: 통신 (communication), SK텔레콤, KT, LG유플러스. Korean Big Three.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example: 화면이 너무 어두워요. 밝기를 올려 주세요.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: The screen is too dark. Please turn up the brightness.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 畫 (picture) + 面 (surface). Related: 화면 보호기 (screen protector), 화면 캡처 (screenshot). Common: 화면을 밝히다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: It's safe to set a lock on your phone.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native word (from 잠그다 to lock). Related: 잠금 화면 (lock screen), 패턴 잠금 (pattern lock). Common: 지문 잠금, 얼굴 잠금.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Enter the password to unlock.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 解 (release) + 除 (remove). Related: 해제하다 (unlock/release), 차단 해제 (unblock). Common: 잠금을 해제하다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: The speaker volume is too low.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'speaker'). Related: 블루투스 스피커, 스피커 소리. Common: 스피커 음량을 높이다/낮추다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example: 마이크가 안 돼서 통화할 수 없어요.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I can't make a call because the microphone isn't working.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'microphone'). Related: 마이크를 켜다 (turn on mic), 음소거 (mute). Common: 통화 마이크가 안 돼요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: The camera on this phone is really good.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'camera'). Related: 전면 카메라 (front), 후면 카메라 (rear). Korean: 카메라 성능 중요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I listen to music with earphones in.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'earphone'). Related: 무선 이어폰 (wireless earbuds), 헤드폰 (headphones). Common: 이어폰을 끼다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I connected to the speaker via Bluetooth.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'Bluetooth'). Related: 블루투스 페어링 (pairing), 블루투스를 켜다. Common: 블루투스로 연결하다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example: 요즘 인공지능 기술이 빠르게 발전하고 있어요.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: AI technology is developing rapidly these days.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 人工 (artificial) + 智能 (intelligence). Related: AI, 인공지능 스피커. Common: 인공지능이 발전하다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I back up my photos to the cloud.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'cloud'). Related: 클라우드 저장소 (cloud storage), 클라우드 백업. Common: 사진을 클라우드에 올리다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I get too many spam messages.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'spam'). Related: 스팸 문자 (spam text), 스팸 차단 (spam blocking). Note: 스팸 also means canned meat.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: My account was hacked, so I changed my password.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'hacking'). Related: 해킹당하다 (be hacked), 해커 (hacker). Common: 계정이 해킹당했어요.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: My computer got a virus.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'virus'). Related: 바이러스에 감염되다 (be infected), 백신 프로그램 (antivirus). Common: 컴퓨터 바이러스.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Make sure to back up important files.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'backup'). Related: 백업하다 (back up), 자동 백업. Common: 파일을 백업해 두다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I can restore the deleted files.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 한자어: 復 (return) + 原 (original). Related: 복원하다 (restore), 공장 초기화 (factory reset). Common: 삭제한 파일을 복원하다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I write my to-do list in my phone's memo app.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword (English 'memo'). Related: 메모하다 (memo), 메모장 (notepad app). Common: 핸드폰 메모에 적다.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example: QR코드를 찍으면 메뉴를 볼 수 있어요.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: You can see the menu if you scan the QR code.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: QR (Quick Response) 코드. Related: QR코드를 스캔하다 (scan QR code), QR코드를 찍다. Korean: 결제, 메뉴, 체크인에 사용.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wash my face and go out.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native word. Related: 세수하다 (wash face), 얼굴 각도 (face angle). Cultural: 얼굴이 작다 = compliment in Korea.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: Your skin is really nice.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 한자어: 皮 (skin) + 膚 (skin). Related: 피부 관리 (skincare), 피부과 (dermatology). Korean: skincare 문화 발달.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I'm losing a lot of hair.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 머리 (head/hair) + 카락 (strand). Related: 머리 (head), 카락 (strand). Common: 머리를 자르다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: Long hair suits you well.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native: 길다 (to be long) + 머리 (hair). Related: 긴 머리가 어울려요. Common: 머리를 길러요.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I cut my hair short.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native: 짧다 (to be short) + 머리 (hair). Related: 단발머리 (bob cut). Common: 머리를 짧게 자르다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I cut my bangs.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 앞 (front) + 머리 (hair). Related: 앞머리 자르기 (cut bangs). Common: 앞머리를 기르다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: Your makeup looks pretty today.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 한자어: 化 (transform) + 粧 (adorn). Related: 화장품 (cosmetics), 화장을 하다 (put on makeup). Common: 화장을 지우다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: It takes 30 minutes to put on makeup in the morning.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Verb form. Related: 진하게/연하게 화장하다 (heavy/light makeup). Common: 아침에 화장하다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I put on red lipstick.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 'lipstick'). Related: 틴트 (lip tint, very popular in Korea), 바르다 (apply). Common: 립스틱을 바르다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I apply sunscreen every day.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword: 선 (sun) + 크림 (cream). Also: 자외선 차단제 (UV blocker). Korean: 피부 보호 필수 문화.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I can see well when I wear glasses.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 한자어: 眼 (eye) + 鏡 (mirror/glass). Related: 안경을 쓰다 (wear), 안경을 벗다 (remove). Common: 시력교정용 안경.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear sunglasses when I go outside.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword: 선 (sun) + 글라스 (glass). Also: 썬글라스. Related: 외출할 때 선글라스를 써요.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I'm wearing contact lenses.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 'lens'). Related: 렌즈를 끼다 (put in), 렌즈를 빼다 (remove). Common: 콘택트 렌즈.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I bought pretty earrings.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 귀 (ear) + 걸이 (hanger). Related: 귀걸이를 하다 (wear). Common: 예쁜 귀걸이를 사다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I received a necklace as a birthday gift.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 목 (neck) + 걸이 (hanger). Related: 목걸이를 하다 (wear). Common: 생일 선물로 목걸이를 받다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: The ring is so pretty.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native word. Related: 반지를 끼다 (wear), 결혼반지 (wedding ring). Common: 손가락에 반지를 끼다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I gave a bracelet as a gift.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 팔 (arm) + 찌 (ornament). Related: 팔찌를 차다/하다 (wear). Common: 팔찌를 선물로 주다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I'm wearing a new watch.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 한자어: 時 (time) + 計 (measure). Related: 손목시계 (wristwatch), 시계를 차다 (wear watch). Adornment.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I'm wearing a white t-shirt.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 't-shirt'). Related: 반팔 티 (short-sleeve), 긴팔 티 (long-sleeve). Common: 흰색 티셔츠.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wore a shirt to the interview.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 'shirt'). Related: 남방 (older Korean term). Common: 면접에 셔츠를 입다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: The blue blouse suits you well.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 'blouse'). Related: 여성용 상의 (women's top). More formal than 티셔츠.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I often wear dresses in summer.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Konglish (one piece). Related: 드레스, 원피스 드레스. Common: 여름 원피스, 치마 원피스.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear a suit for interviews.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 한자어: 正 (proper) + 裝 (attire). Related: 정장을 차려입다 (dress up). Common: 면접 정장, 회의 정장.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear a jacket in autumn.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 'jacket'). Related: 가을 재킷, 자켓. Common: 가을에 재킷을 입다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear a long coat in winter.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 'coat'). Related: 롱코트 (long coat), 트렌치코트. Common: 겨울 긴 코트.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: A padded jacket is essential for Korean winters.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 'padding/padded'). Related: 롱패딩 (long puffer). Cultural: 한국 겨울 필수 아이템.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: It was windy, so I wore a jumper.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 'jumper'). Related: 가볍고 따뜻한 자켓. Common: 겨울 점퍼를 입다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wore jeans and a t-shirt.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 한자어: 靑 (blue/indigo) + 바지 (pants). Related: 스키니 청바지 (skinny jeans). Common: 청바지에 티셔츠.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear shorts when it's hot.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 반 (half) + 바지 (pants). Related: 핫팬츠 (hot pants). Common: 더울 때 반바지를 입다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I change into sportswear when I exercise.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 한자어: 運動 (exercise) + 복 (clothes). Related: 운동할 때, 갈아입다 (change). Common: 헬스 운동복.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I change into pajamas and go to sleep.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 잠 (sleep) + 옷 (clothes). Also: 파자마. Related: 잠옷으로 갈아입다. Common: 편한 잠옷.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I change my underwear every day.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 속 (inner) + 옷 (clothes). Related: 내의 (undershirt), 매일 갈아입다. Common: hygiene 중요.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I lost one sock.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native word. Related: 한 짝 (one of a pair), 짝짝이 양말 (mismatched). Common: 양말을 신다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear dress shoes when I go to work.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native word. Related: 구두를 신다 (wear), 구두를 닦다 (polish). Common: 회사에 갈 때 구두.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I often wear sneakers because they're comfortable.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 한자어: 運動 (exercise) + 화 (shoes). Related: 편한 신발, 스니커즈. Common: 자주 신는 신발.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear slippers at home.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 'slipper'). Related: 실내 슬리퍼 (indoor), 실외 슬리퍼. Common: 집에서 슬리퍼를 신다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear boots when it rains.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 'boots'). Related: 레인부츠 (rain boots), 롱부츠 (tall). Common: 비 올 때 부츠.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: It was raining heavily, so I wore a raincoat.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 우 (rain) + 비 (cover). Related: 우산 (umbrella), 비 오는 날. Common: 비가 많이 올 때.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I go out wearing gloves in winter.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native word. Related: 장갑을 끼다 (wear), 벙어리장갑 (mittens). Common: 겨울 장갑.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear a scarf when it's cold.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 목도리 = traditional Korean; 스카프 = loanword. Related: 머플러. Common: 추울 때 목도리를 하다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: The pants are big, so I wear a belt.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 'belt'). Related: 벨트를 매다 (wear), 가죽 벨트. Common: 바지가 커서 벨트.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: My father puts on a necktie and goes to work.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword (English 'necktie'). Related: 넥타이를 매다 (tie), 보타이 (bow tie). Common: 출근할 때 넥타이.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I left my wallet at home.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native word. Related: 지갑을 잃어버리다 (lose), 카드지갑 (card holder). Common: 지갑을 챙기다.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: Please take an umbrella.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native word (from 우 rain + 산 spread). Related: 우산을 쓰다 (open), 접이식 우산. Common: 비 오는 날.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I carry a backpack when I travel.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native word. Related: 배낭을 메다 (carry), 배낭여행 (backpacking). Common: 학생 배낭.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example: 저는 생머리라서 파마를 해 본 적이 없어요.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I have naturally straight hair, so I've never gotten a perm.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 생 (natural/raw) + 머리 (hair). Related: 파마 (perm), 자연스러운 머리. Korean: 전통 미의 기준.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I got a magic straight to straighten my curly hair.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native adjective: 곱슬곱슬하다 (curly/wavy). Related: 매직 스트레이트 (straightening treatment). Korean: 곱슬머리 교정 서비스.
