자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Literally 'it doesn't even make words.' Expresses strong disbelief at something unreasonable.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: You worked hard today too.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 고생(苦生 hardship) + 했다(did). Said to acknowledge effort. Very common after work or difficult projects.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: You passed the exam? Well done!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 잘(well) + 했다(did). Used to praise or congratulate. More specific accomplishment than 고생했어요.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I got angry for no reason.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Implies action was unnecessary or regrettable. Examples: 괜히 걱정했어요(I worried needlessly), 괜히 가봤어요(I went for no reason).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: There's nothing in the fridge.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 아무(any) + 것(thing) + 도(even/also). Used with negative verbs only. Related: 아무도(nobody), 아무데나(anywhere).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: There's nobody at home.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 아무(any) + 도(even). Must be used with negative verb. Related: 아무것도(nothing), 아무도 없다(there's nobody).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Please sit anywhere.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 아무데(any place) + 나(or, any). With 나 it's positive: 'anywhere is fine.' Related: 아무데서나도 같다(same anywhere).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: 먹고 싶은 거 있어요? — 아무거나 괜찮아요.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Is there anything you want to eat? — Anything is fine.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 아무것(anything) + 이나 → 아무거나. Used when you have no preference. Very common response.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: 얼굴이 안 좋아 보여요. 무슨 일이에요?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: You don't look well. What's wrong?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 무슨(what kind of) + 일(matter/event). A caring way to ask about someone's problem. Shows concern.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: what's the matter? / why are you like that?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Why are you suddenly like that?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 왜(why) + 그래요(are you like that). Can show concern or confusion. Used in concerned conversation.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm looking forward to the trip next week.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 기대(期待 expectation). 기대되다(to be anticipated), 기대하다(to look forward to). Shows positive emotion about future.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm troubled about what to choose.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 고민(苦悶 worry/anguish). 고민하다(to agonize over), 고민 상담(counseling). Expresses internal struggle.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: You went to Europe? I'm envious!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 부럽다(to be envious, ㅂ irregular: 부러워요). Used lightheartedly, not negatively. Shows admiration.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: what do I do? / how do I do it?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: How do I do this?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 어떻게(how) + 해요(do). Can ask for instructions or express helplessness. Context-dependent meaning.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Sorry, but please speak slowly.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 천천히(slowly). Essential for language learners. Related: 천천히 읽어 주세요(please read slowly).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I didn't hear. Please say it again.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 다시(again). Essential learner phrase for repetition. Related: 다시 한 번(one more time).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm sorry, I can't speak Korean well.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 잘 못하다(can't do well). Useful disclaimer for learners. Humble/polite way to set expectations.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: What does this word mean?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 뜻(meaning). Essential for vocabulary learning. Related: 뜻을 모르다(to not know the meaning), 뜻이 뭐예요.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: What's this in Korean? — It's 'sagwa' (apple).
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: (으)로(in language/means). 영어로(in English), 일본어로(in Japanese). Extremely helpful phrase for learners.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Excuse me, where is the bathroom?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 화장실(化粧室 restroom, lit. makeup room). One of most essential survival phrases for travelers.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: How long does it take from here to Myeongdong?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 걸리다(to take time). Very practical for travel and daily life. Related: 시간이 걸리다(it takes time).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: What time is it now? — It's three o'clock.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 몇(how many). Korean uses two number systems: native Korean for hours, Sino-Korean for minutes.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Is the subway station close from here?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 가깝다(to be close, ㅂ irregular: 가까워요). Opposite: 멀어요(far). Practical for navigating.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: it's okay / I'm fine / no worries
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm sorry. — It's okay.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Most versatile Korean expression. Means 'it's fine,' 'no thanks,' 'are you okay?' as question. Essential phrase.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Just a moment, I'll be right there.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 잠깐(a moment) + 만(just/only). Polite request for time. Related: 잠시만요(slightly more formal).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Thank you. — You're welcome.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Literally 'not at all (not even one in ten million).' Somewhat formal; 아니에요 is more casual.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Can you help me? — Of course!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Short for 그러면요. Enthusiastic agreement. Stronger: 당연하죠(of course, definitely).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Can you come tomorrow? — Probably.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 아마(maybe) + 도(softener). Less committal than 네 but more likely than 글쎄요. Shows uncertainty.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: 길이 막힐 수도 있어요. — 그럴 수도 있어요.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: There might be traffic. — That could be.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 그렇다 + -(으)ㄹ 수도 있다. Diplomatic way to partially agree or acknowledge possibility.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: I don't know / I'm not sure
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I don't know the answer to this question.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 모르다(not know) + 겠(uncertainty). Softer than 몰라요(I don't know, blunt). Shows politeness.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Do you want to go together? — I'll think about it.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 생각하다(think) + 아/어 보다(try) + ㄹ게요(will). Polite way to defer a decision without saying no.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: A: 요즘 날씨가 너무 덥죠? B: 그러니까요.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: A: The weather is so hot lately, right? B: I know, right.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Used to strongly agree with what someone just said. Very natural in casual conversation.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: A: 내일 올 거죠? B: 당연하죠!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: A: You're coming tomorrow, right? B: Of course!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Confident, friendly way to say 'obviously.' 당연히 is adverb form. Strong affirmation.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: A: 매운 거 좋아해요. B: 저도 그래요!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: A: I like spicy food. B: Same here!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: More specific than 저도요. Literally 'I'm also like that.' Expresses shared feelings or habits.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: A: 점심에 냉면 먹을까요? B: 좋은 생각이에요!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: A: Shall we have cold noodles for lunch? B: That's a good idea!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Polite agreement with suggestion. Variant: 좋은 생각이네요(more surprised tone). Encouraging phrase.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: A: 이 단어 뜻 알아요? B: 잘 모르겠는데요.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: A: Do you know the meaning of this word? B: I'm not really sure.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Softer, more polite than 몰라요. -는데요 ending leaves room for discussion. Humble response.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: It looks difficult but I'll give it a try.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 한번(once, 'for a try'). Shows willingness to attempt something. Very commonly used affirmative.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I don't have time today, let's meet next time.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Direct way to decline invitations. Can soften: 시간이 좀 없어서요...(I don't have much time...). Commonly used.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm a bit busy this week.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: From 바쁘다. Adding 좀 makes it softer. Very frequently used to explain unavailability.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm tired because I had a lot of work today.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: From 피곤하다. Most common daily expression. 너무 피곤해요(I'm so tired). Relatable phrase.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I haven't eaten lunch yet so I'm hungry.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: From 배고프다. 배(stomach). Very casual and commonly used. Related: 배가 고프다(same).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm thirsty after exercising.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: From 목마르다. 목(throat). Also: 목이 말라요(same). Common physical need expression.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I just arrived, where are you?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Very commonly texted when meeting someone. Casual: 도착!, 나 도착(informal). Essential for meetups.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Sorry I'm late, traffic was bad.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Polite apology. Casual: 늦어서 미안해요. Very casual: 늦어서 미안!(informal). Frequent need.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: I'll go first; I'll head out
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'll head out first, good work everyone!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Said when leaving before others, especially at work. Very polite and considerate. Respectful farewell.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I had fun today, see you tomorrow!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Common farewell. Swap 내일 for: 다음 주에 봐요(see you next week), 나중에 봐요(see you later).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: I'll contact you; I'll be in touch
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'll check the schedule and contact you.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 연락(contact/communication). Most frequently used parting phrase. Shows intent to follow up.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Well then, take care, I'll be in touch again.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Warm farewell, especially when you won't see someone for a while. 잘 지내다(to be doing well).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: It's raining outside, get home safe!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Very common Korean farewell showing care. Casual: 조심히 가!(informal). Expresses concern.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Today was fun, let's meet again next time!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Warm, friendly farewell. 또(again) emphasizes future meeting. Natural ending to hangout.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: I had fun; it was enjoyable
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I had fun traveling together.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: From 즐겁다(enjoyable). Past tense standard here. Shows appreciation for shared time.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I don't have enough money, so I need to earn more.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Most basic word for money. Native Korean word. Collocations: 돈을 벌다(earn money), 돈을 쓰다(spend money), 돈이 많다(have lots of money).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Can I pay with cash?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 현(現 present) + 금(金 gold/money). Used when distinguishing from card payment. Related: 현금 결제(cash payment).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I'll pay by card.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Loanword from English. In Korea, card payment extremely common. Related: 신용카드(credit card), 체크카드(debit card).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I checked my credit card limit.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 신용(信用 credit/trust) + 카드(card). Has monthly billing cycle. Related: 신용한도(credit limit), 신용점수(credit score).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: A debit card deducts directly from your account balance.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: More popular than credit cards among younger Koreans for budget control. Immediate deduction from account.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I want to open a new account.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 계좌번호(account number). 개설하다(open an account). Related: 은행 계좌(bank account), 저축 계좌(savings account).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Let me check how much is left in my bankbook.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Physical bankbooks still used in Korea, though less common now. Related: 통장 잔액(account balance), 통장 사본(bankbook copy).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I'm saving 30% of my salary every month.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 저축하다(to save). 저축 계좌(savings account). General term for saving money.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The fixed deposit interest rate went up.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 예금(預金 money deposited). 정기예금(fixed-term deposit), 보통예금(regular deposit). Banking product.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I'm going to make a withdrawal at the ATM.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 출(出 out) + 금(金 money). Opposite of 입금(deposit). Related: 출금 수수료(withdrawal fee).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I transferred money through mobile banking.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 이체하다(to transfer). 계좌이체(bank transfer), 모바일 이체(mobile transfer). Very common in daily transactions.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The fee is expensive when sending money overseas.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 송(送 send) + 금(金 money). Often used for international transfers. Related: 국제 송금(international remittance).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I took out a loan to buy a house.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 대출받다(take out a loan), 대출금(loan amount). Related: 주택 대출(home loan), 학자금 대출(student loan).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The interest is so high that it's burdensome.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Can refer to interest earned on savings or interest paid on loans. Related: 이자율(interest rate), 월 이자(monthly interest).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: How much is the inter-bank transfer fee?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Applies to banking fees, service charges, commissions. Related: 송금 수수료(remittance fee), 관리 수수료(maintenance fee).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The payment didn't go through because of insufficient balance.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 잔(殘 remaining) + 액(額 amount). 잔액조회(balance inquiry). Related: 통장 잔액(account balance).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: My salary was deposited into my account.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 입(入 in) + 금(金 money). Opposite of 출금(withdrawal). Related: 자동 입금(automatic deposit).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Where is the nearest ATM?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Pronounced 에이티엠 in Korean. Also called 현금인출기. Found everywhere in Korea.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 비밀번호를 세 번 틀리면 카드가 잠겨요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: If you enter the wrong PIN three times, your card gets locked.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 비밀(secret) + 번호(number). Used for all passwords and PINs. Related: 비밀번호 변경(password change).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The exchange rate is bad if you exchange at the airport.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 환전하다(to exchange currency). 환전소(currency exchange booth). Related: 환전 수수료(exchange fee).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: What is today's exchange rate?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 환(換 exchange) + 율(率 rate). Fluctuates daily. Related: 환율 변동(exchange rate fluctuation).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I want to exchange dollars to won.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Loanword from English. 미국 달러(US dollars). Most common foreign currency in Korea.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 일본 여행 가기 전에 엔화를 준비했어요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I prepared yen before my trip to Japan.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Japanese currency. 엔화(more formal). Related: 엔화 환전(yen exchange).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The euro has gone up a lot.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: European currency. 유로화(more formal). Related: 유로 지역(eurozone).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: You have to pay in yuan in China.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Chinese currency. 위안화(more formal). Related: 중국 위안(Chinese yuan).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Do you need a receipt?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Very common question at Korean stores. 영수증 발급(receipt issuance). Related: 영수증 보관(keep receipt).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Is this the price including tax?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 세(稅 tax) + 금(金 money). 세금 신고(tax filing). Related: 소득세(income tax), 부가세(VAT).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: VAT is included in this price.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Short for 부가가치세. Korea's VAT is 10%. Related: 세전 가격(pre-tax price), 세후 가격(after-tax price).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I'll pay in 3 monthly installments.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Very common in Korea. 무이자 할부(interest-free installments). Related: 할부금(installment amount), 할부 기간(installment period).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Please process it as a one-time payment.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Opposite of 할부. Paying full amount at once. Related: 전액 결제(full payment).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The monthly rent is 500,000 won per month.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 월(月 month) + 세(稅 rent). Most common rental system for young Koreans. Related: 월세 계약(rental contract).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I signed a 2-year key money deposit contract.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Unique Korean rental system. Large deposit replaces monthly rent. Related: 전세금(key money amount), 전세 계약(lease agreement).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: What should I do to get my deposit back?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Required for both 월세 and 전세 rentals. Related: 보증금 반환(deposit refund), 보증금 분쟁(deposit dispute).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: How much is the maintenance fee for this apartment?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Monthly fee for building maintenance, often separate from rent. Related: 관리비 포함(maintenance included), 관리비 미포함(maintenance not included).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The utility bills were high this month.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Umbrella term covering electricity, water, gas, etc. Related: 공과금 고지서(utility bill statement).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 여름에 에어컨을 많이 쓰면 전기세가 올라가요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: If you use the AC a lot in summer, the electricity bill goes up.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 전기(electricity) + 세(fee). Korea uses progressive pricing. Related: 전기료(electricity charge), 전력 사용량(electricity usage).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The water bill usually isn't much.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 수도(waterworks) + 세(fee). Generally cheaper than electricity. Related: 수도료(water charge), 상수도(tap water).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 겨울에 난방 때문에 가스비가 많이 나와요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The gas bill is high in winter because of heating.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 가스(gas) + 비(cost). Many Korean homes use gas for heating/cooking. Related: 가스료(gas charge), 도시가스(city gas).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I pay the internet bill by automatic transfer every month.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 인터넷(internet) + 비(cost). Korea has world-class internet speeds. Related: 인터넷 요금(internet fee), 자동 이체(automatic transfer).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The health insurance premium went up.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 보험(保險 insurance) + 료(料 fee). National health insurance mandatory in Korea. Related: 보험 가입(insurance enrollment), 보험금(insurance payout).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I'm putting 300,000 won into my savings plan every month.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Fixed monthly deposit for set period. 적금 만기(maturity), 적금 이자(savings interest). Popular savings product in Korea.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Have you ever invested in a fund?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Loanword from English. 펀드 매니저(fund manager), 뮤추얼 펀드(mutual fund). Investment vehicle.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The stock market is unstable these days.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 주식 투자(stock investment). Very popular among young Koreans. Related: 주가(stock price), 주식 거래(stock trading).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Many people invest in real estate.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 투자(investment) + 하다(to do). Can be used for money, time, or effort. Related: 투자자(investor), 투자금(investment amount).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 열심히 일해서 돈을 많이 벌고 싶어요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I want to work hard and earn a lot of money.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 돈을 벌다(most common collocation). Irregular verb. Related: 수입(income), 소득(earnings).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 이번 달에 돈을 너무 많이 썼어요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I spent too much money this month.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 쓰다 has multiple meanings: spend, write, use, wear (hat). Past: 썼다. Related: 지출(expenditure), 지르다(splurge, casual).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I pack a lunchbox to save money.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Also means to cherish/treasure something or someone. Related: 절약(saving), 알뜰살뜰(thrifty).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 필요 없는 물건을 사는 건 낭비예요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Buying things you don't need is a waste.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 낭비(waste) + 하다(to do). Can apply to money, time, resources. Related: 낭비벽(wasteful habit), 낭비하기 쉬운(easy to waste).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Here is your change.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: From 거스르다(to give back) + 돈(money). Less common now due to card payments. Related: 잔돈(small change).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I have so many coins that it's heavy.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Korean coins: 10원, 50원, 100원, 500원 denominations. Related: 동전 주머니(coin purse), 동전 교환(coin exchange).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Did you watch the soccer game today?
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Used for competitive sports matches. 경기장(stadium), 경기 결과(game result). Related: 경쟁(competition), 경기력(performance).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: That athlete is really amazing.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 선(先 first/best) + 수(人 person). Used for all athletes. Related: 축구 선수(soccer player), 프로 선수(professional athlete).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Which team do you cheer for?
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Used in sports and work. Related: 팀 스포츠(team sport), 팀 플레이(teamwork).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example: 새 감독이 오고 나서 팀이 강해졌어요.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: The team got stronger after the new coach came.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Same word for film directors. Context determines meaning. Related: 감독 능력(coaching ability), 감독 교체(change of coach).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: The referee gave a red card.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 심판하다(to judge/referee). Used across all sports. Related: 심판 판정(referee call), 주심(head referee).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: As many as 50,000 spectators came.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 관(觀 watch) + 중(衆 crowd). Specifically for live event audiences. Related: 관중 응원(spectator support).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: My throat hurts from cheering so hard.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 응원하다(to cheer). Korean cheering culture is very enthusiastic. Related: 응원가(cheering song), 응원단(fan club).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: They advanced to the finals with this victory.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 승리하다(to win/be victorious). More formal than 이기다(to win). Related: 승리감(sense of victory).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: They lost unfortunately, but they fought well.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 패배하다(to be defeated). More formal than 지다(to lose). Related: 패배감(sense of defeat).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: The game ended in a 1-1 draw.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 무(無 no) + 승부(승 win, 부 lose). Neither team wins. Related: 비기다(to tie), 동점(tie score).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: What's the score right now?
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Used in sports and academics. 점수를 따다(score points). Related: 최종 점수(final score), 누적 점수(cumulative score).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: They scored a goal at the end and made a comeback.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 골을 넣다(score a goal), 골키퍼(goalkeeper). Related: 결승골(winning goal), 자책골(own goal).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: They finally won the championship!
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 우승하다(to win championship). 우승팀(champion team). Related: 우승 경력(championship history).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Being runner-up is also a great result.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 준(準 semi/quasi) + 우승(championship). Second place. Related: 준우승 팀(runner-up team).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: We won many medals at this Olympics.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 메달을 따다(win a medal). Loanword from English. Related: 메달 리스트(medal list).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I'm so happy to have won a gold medal.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 금(金 gold) + 메달(medal). Highest honor in competition. Related: 금메달 리스트(gold medalist).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: A silver medal is also a really proud result.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 은(銀 silver) + 메달(medal). Second place award. Related: 은메달 리스트(silver medalist).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: They barely secured the bronze medal.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 동(銅 bronze/copper) + 메달(medal). Third place award. Related: 동메달 리스트(bronze medalist).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: The 2024 Olympics were held in Paris.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Korea hosted 1988 Seoul Olympics and 2018 PyeongChang Winter Olympics. Major sporting event.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example: 월드컵 때 한국 거리가 빨간색으로 물들어요.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: During the World Cup, Korean streets are colored red.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Korea co-hosted 2002 FIFA World Cup. Red Devils=famous fan group. Major global event.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Gymnasts have really great flexibility.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 체(身 body) + 조(體 exercise). Includes floor, vault, bars. Related: 체조 선수(gymnast), 리듬 체조(rhythmic gymnastics).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: In weightlifting, technique is important, not just strength.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 역(力 power) + 도(道 way). Korea historically strong. Related: 역도 선수(weightlifter), 역도 대회(weightlifting competition).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Korea is a powerhouse in archery.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 양(洋 Western) + 궁(弓 bow). Korea dominates Olympic archery. Related: 양궁 선수(archer).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Fencing requires fast reaction speed.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Korea won many Olympic medals. Related: 펜싱 선수(fencer).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Learning judo helps with self-defense.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 유(柔 gentle) + 도(道 way). Originally from Japan, very popular in Korea. Related: 유도 도복(judo uniform).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Wrestling matches are divided by weight class.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Korea has Olympic wrestling tradition. Related: 레슬링 선수(wrestler).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Boxing is also popular as a diet exercise.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. 복싱 체육관(boxing gym). Related: 복싱 글러브(boxing gloves).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Let's go skating in winter.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Includes ice and roller skating. 김연아(Korea's most famous skater). Related: 스케이트(skates), 스케이팅장(skating rink).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I want to learn how to snowboard.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Popular at Korean ski resorts. Related: 스노보드 타다(snowboard), 스키장(ski resort).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Many people enjoy surfing in Yangyang.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Yangyang on Korea's east coast=most popular surfing spot. Related: 서핑보드(surfboard), 파도(wave).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I go to an indoor climbing gym.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Also called 볼더링(bouldering). Very trendy exercise in Korea. Related: 클라이밍장(climbing gym), 클라이밍화(climbing shoes).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I jog along the Han River every morning.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 한강 parks=popular jogging spots in Seoul. Related: 조깅로(jogging route), 조깅 속도(jogging pace).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example: 운동 전에 스트레칭을 꼭 해야 해요.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: You must stretch before exercising.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Important for injury prevention. 스트레칭하다(to stretch). Related: 스트레칭 운동(stretching exercise).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I did 50 sit-ups.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Literally 'upper body raising.' Part of Korean fitness/school tests. Related: 복근(abdominal muscles).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I do 30 push-ups every day.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Literally 'arm bend-and-extend.' Part of Korean military fitness tests. Related: 팔 힘(arm strength).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Squats are good for lower body exercise.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. One of most popular strength exercises. Related: 하체(lower body), 다리 근육(leg muscle).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: It's hard to hold a plank for more than 1 minute.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Great for core strength. Related: 복부(abdomen), 코어(core).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: You build muscle when you exercise.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 근육통(muscle soreness), 근육질(muscular build). Related: 근육 발달(muscle development).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I get tired easily because my stamina is low.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 체(身 body) + 력(力 power). 체력 관리(maintaining fitness). Related: 체력 테스트(fitness test).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Endurance is important for marathons.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 지구(sustain) + 력(power). Ability to keep going long term. Related: 장거리 달리기(long-distance running).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Doing yoga improves your flexibility.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 유연(柔軟 flexible) + 성(性 quality). Important for preventing injuries. Related: 스트레칭(stretching).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: This food is high in calories.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. 칼로리 소모(calorie burn). Related: 칼로리 계산(calorie counting).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example: 운동 후에 단백질을 섭취하는 게 좋아요.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: It's good to consume protein after exercising.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 닭가슴살(chicken breast)=go-to protein source for Korean fitness fans. Related: 단백질 식단(protein diet).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I reduce carbohydrates when dieting.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Often shortened to 탄수 in casual speech. Rice=Korea's main carb source. Related: 저탄수(low-carb).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: You need to consume nutrients in a balanced way.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 영양(營養 nutrition) + 소(素 element). Includes vitamins, minerals, etc. Related: 영양가(nutritional value).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I'm putting together a healthy meal plan.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 식단 관리(diet management), 식단표(meal plan chart). Related: 영양 식단(balanced diet).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I go to the gym after work.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 헬스(health) + 장(place). Also called 피트니스 센터. Related: 헬스 회원(gym membership).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I'm learning exercises from a personal trainer.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Often shortened to PT(피티). 퍼스널 트레이너(full form). Related: 1대1 레슨(one-on-one lesson).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I tried changing my workout routine.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Used for workout and daily routines. Related: 루틴 운동(routine exercise).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example: 워밍업 없이 운동하면 다칠 수 있어요.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: You can get injured if you exercise without warming up.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Essential before intense exercise. Related: 쿨다운(cool-down), 준비 운동(warm-up exercise).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I always watch the news in the morning.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Major Korean channels: KBS, MBC, SBS. Related: 뉴스 기사(news article), 속보(breaking news).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Have you read this article?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 뉴스 기사(news article). Also means driver(택시 기사) in different context. Related: 신문 기사(newspaper article).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example: 요즘은 종이 신문을 읽는 사람이 적어요.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: These days, few people read paper newspapers.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 신(新 new) + 문(文 writing). 신문사(newspaper company). Related: 조간 신문(morning edition), 저녁 판(evening edition).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I subscribe to a fashion magazine.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 잡(雜 miscellaneous) + 지(紙 paper). Covers specialty topics. Related: 잡지 구독(magazine subscription).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: What time does that broadcast start?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 방송하다(to broadcast), 방송국(broadcasting station). Related: 생방송(live broadcast), 녹화 방송(recorded broadcast).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Let's flip through the channels.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Also used for YouTube channels. Related: 채널 변경(change channel), 유튜브 채널(YouTube channel).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: What interesting programs are on these days?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Often shortened to 프로. Covers TV/radio programs. Related: 프로그램 시간(program time), 시간표(TV guide).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Korean variety shows are really fun.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Short for 예능 프로그램. Signature genre of Korean TV. Related: 개그 프로그램(comedy show).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I like nature documentaries.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Often shortened to 다큐. Related: 다큐멘터리 영화(documentary film), 조사 다큐멘터리(investigative documentary).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: That news anchor has precise pronunciation.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Also called 아나운서(announcer). Respected profession in Korea. Related: 앵커(anchor).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: The reporter is broadcasting live from the scene.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 기(記 record) + 자(者 person). 취재하다(cover a story). Related: 신문 기자(newspaper reporter), 방송 기자(broadcast journalist).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Isn't this ad really funny?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 광고하다(to advertise). Korean ads known for celebrity usage. Related: 광고 시간(commercial break), 광고 홍보(advertising campaign).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I listen to the radio during my commute.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Korean radio shows feature celebrity DJs. Related: 라디오 프로그램(radio program).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example: 한국어 공부할 때 팟캐스트가 도움이 돼요.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Podcasts help when studying Korean.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Increasingly popular in Korea. Related: 팟캐스트 에피소드(podcast episode).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Do you want to go see a movie this weekend?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 영화를 보다(watch a movie). Korean cinema world-renowned. Related: 영화 개봉(movie release), 영화제(film festival).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: The newly opened movie theater has great facilities.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Major theater chains: CGV, 메가박스, 롯데시네마. Related: 영화표(movie ticket), 상영(screening).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I like director Bong Joon-ho's movies.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Same word as sports coach. Context determines meaning. Related: 감독 작품(director's work).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: That actor's acting is really natural.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Gender-neutral term. 남자 배우(actor), 여자 배우(actress) for specificity. Related: 유명 배우(famous actor).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Who is the main character of this drama?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 주(主 main) + 인(人 person) + 공(公 public). Used for movies/dramas/novels. Related: 악역(villain).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: This movie was filmed on Jeju Island.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 촬영하다(to film/shoot). 촬영지(filming location). Related: 촬영 중(filming in progress).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: A new movie is releasing next week.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 개봉하다(to release a movie). 개봉일(release date). Related: 개봉 영화(recently released movie).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I left a review after watching the movie.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 관람하다(more formal than 보다). 관람객(viewer/visitor). Related: 영화 관람(watching a movie).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example: 자막 없이 한국 영화를 보고 싶어요.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I want to watch Korean movies without subtitles.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 자(字 letter) + 막(幕 screen). 한글 자막(Korean subtitles). Related: 영문 자막(English subtitles).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Is there a Korean dubbed version?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. 더빙하다(to dub). Related: 더빙판(dubbed version), 자막판(subtitled version).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example: 인기 있는 영화는 미리 예매해야 해요.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: You have to book tickets in advance for popular movies.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 예매하다(to pre-book). Used for movies/concerts/trains. Related: 예매 사이트(booking site).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: What kind of music do you like?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 음(音 sound) + 악(樂 music). K-pop made Korean music globally popular. Related: 음악 장르(music genre).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Do you have a favorite singer?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 가(歌 sing) + 수(人 person). Used for solo artists/group members. Related: 가수 활동(singing career).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example: 요즘 한국 인디 밴드가 인기 있어요.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Korean indie bands are popular these days.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. 밴드 음악(band music). Related: 락 밴드(rock band), 인디 밴드(indie band).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: That singer also composes their own music.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 작(作 make) + 곡(曲 song). 작곡가(composer). Related: 작곡 실력(composing ability).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Who wrote the lyrics for this song?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 작(作 make) + 사(辭 words). 작사가(lyricist). Related: 가사(lyrics), 가사 의미(meaning of lyrics).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: A new album came out.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. K-pop albums include photocards/photobooks. Related: 신곡 앨범(new album).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: They released a single before the album.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Single song release, often teaser for album. Related: 신곡(new song).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: The music video views exceeded 100 million.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Often abbreviated as MV(엠브이). K-pop MVs known for high production. Related: 뮤직비디오 감독(MV director).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: The concert tickets sold out in 5 minutes.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. K-pop concerts known for organized fan culture. Related: 콘서트 티켓(concert ticket).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I saw the singer up close at the fan meeting.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Event where fans meet favorite artists. Very popular in K-pop culture. Related: 팬 사인회(fan signing event).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I went to see a musical performance.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 공연하다(to perform). Covers concerts/plays/musicals. Related: 공연 일정(performance schedule).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: My dream is to sing on stage.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 무대에 서다(stand on stage), 무대 뒤(backstage). Related: 무대 의상(stage costume).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: The stage lighting was really cool.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 조(照 shine) + 명(明 bright). Important for concerts/performances. Related: 스팟 라이트(spotlight).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I can't hear the microphone well.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Also shortened to 마이크로폰. Related: 마이크 테스트(mic check).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I play music through a Bluetooth speaker.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Refers to device, not a person. Related: 블루투스(Bluetooth), 음향 시스템(sound system).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: You dance really well!
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 춤을 추다(to dance). K-pop famous for synchronized group dances. Related: 춤 실력(dancing ability).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: The choreography for the new song looks difficult.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 안(安 peace) + 무(舞 dance). 안무가(choreographer). Related: 안무 연습(choreography practice).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I was moved by that actor's acting.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 연기하다(to act). 연기력(acting ability). Related: 연기 실력(acting skills).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I'm happy that I passed the audition.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. K-pop trainees go through rigorous auditions. Related: 오디션 지원(audition application).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: That group debuted last year.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 데뷔하다(to debut). Major milestone in K-pop/acting careers. Related: 데뷔곡(debut song).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: This song is the biggest hit of the year.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 히트(hit) + 곡(song). Achieves widespread popularity. Related: 대히트(huge hit).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: This song reached number 1 on the music chart.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Melon, Genie, Bugs=major Korean music chart platforms. Related: 차트 진입(enter the chart).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I stream dramas on Netflix.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. 스트리밍 서비스(streaming service). Related: OTT 플랫폼(over-the-top platform).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Please subscribe to my YouTube channel.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 구독하다(to subscribe), 구독자(subscriber). Related: 채널 구독(channel subscription), 정기 구독(subscription).

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I posted a movie review on my blog.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. 리뷰를 쓰다(write a review). Related: 평점(rating), 감상평(review comment).
